cse220.assign5
Class Recursion

java.lang.Object
  cse220.assign5.Recursion

public class Recursion
extends java.lang.Object

Various recursive function implementations to get a feel for how recursion works.

Searches through A[left,right] for key using linear search.

Parameters:
A - reference to the array.
left - the index of the leftmost element.
right - the index of the rightmost element.
key - the key to search for.
Returns:
the index of the element, relative to left, if found; -1 otherwise.

powDC

public static int powDC(int base,
                        int exp)
Computes the value of base^exp using divide and conquer strategy. 
 aˆn = 1, if n == 0
 aˆn = aˆ(n/2) * aˆ(n/2), if n is even (n % 2 == 0)
 aˆn = aˆ((n-1)/2) * aˆ((n-1)/2) * a, if n is odd (n % 2 != 0)

Parameters:
base - the base.
exp - the exponent.
Returns:
the value of base^exp.
